get.description: Full player bio and details, including injury notes, for all active players.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

get.description: Full team information: team name and city, conference and division, and colors. Also contains basic fantasy info such as IDs as well as full stadium data. This endpoint returns the teams currently active in the league.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

get.description: Returns true if there is at least one game being played at the time of the request or false if there are none.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

get.description: Full statistical information for a specified game, down to the team and player stat level, delivered live during the game, called per individual game.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: gameid
parameters.description: The GameID of an NHL game. GameIDs can be found in the Games API. Valid entries are 14620 or 16905

get.description: Full statistical information for a specified game, down to the team and player stat level, delivered live during the games, called for all games on a given date.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: date
parameters.description:
The date of the game(s).
Examples: 2017-OCT-31, 2018-FEB-15.

get.description: This method returns all box scores for a given date, but only returns player stats that have changed in the last X minutes as specified in your API call. By definition this is a live endpoint, not final.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: date
parameters.description:
The date of the game(s).
Examples: 2017-OCT-31, 2018-FEB-15.

parameters.name: minutes
parameters.description: Only returns player statistics that have changed in the last X minutes. You specify how many minutes in time to go back. Valid entries are: 1 or 2.

get.description: Full player bio and details, including injury notes, for all available free agents unattached to a team.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

get.description: Full scores and gameday info delivered live and post-game. Live data includes period and score info. Gameday info includes weather, TV channel etc

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: date
parameters.description:
The date of the game(s).
Examples: 2017-OCT-31, 2018-FEB-15.

get.description: Home and away teams, date and time, season type and week etc. are included. Also includes gameday information. This includes full stadium information (capacity, lat/long, surface etc.), top-line betting information (spread, moneyline, total), weather conditions, and broadcast information.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: season
parameters.description:
Year of the season (with optional season type).
Examples: 2018, 2018PRE, 2018POST, 2018STAR, 2019, etc.

get.description: News

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

get.description: News - by Date

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: date
parameters.description:
The date of the news.
Examples: 2017-OCT-31, 2018-FEB-15.

get.description: News - by Player

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: playerid
parameters.description: Unique FantasyData Player ID. Example:10000507.

get.description: Returns the box score statistical record for all involved players across a given date, updated live as the game takes place.
get.summary: Player Game Stats - by Date [Live & Final]

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: date
parameters.description:
The date of the game(s).
Examples: 2017-OCT-31, 2018-FEB-15.

get.description: Returns all season-long stats (i.e. the season total, not each individual game record) for all players for a given season.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: season
parameters.description:
Year of the season.
Examples: 2016, 2017.

get.description: Returns all season-long stats (i.e. the season total, not each individual game record) for a given team's players in a given season.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: season
parameters.description:
Year of the season.
Examples: 2016, 2017.

parameters.name: team
parameters.description:
The abbreviation of the requested team.
Examples: SF, NYY.

get.description: Full player bio and details, including injury notes, for all available players by team.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: team
parameters.description:
The abbreviation of the requested team.
Examples: SF, NYY.

get.description: Returns all stadiums in the league with capacity, surface, latitude/longitude, city and state (and where applicable country.)

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

get.description: Returns the box score statistical record team-wide (aggregated from all players) for all games on a given date, delivered live.
get.summary: Team Game Stats - by Date [Live & Final]

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: date
parameters.description:
The date of the game(s).
Examples: 2018-JAN-31, 2017-OCT-01.

get.description: Returns all season-long stats (i.e. the season total, not each individual game record) for all teams (aggregated from all players) for a given season.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: season
parameters.description:
Year of the season.
Examples: 2016, 2017.

get.description: Player Details - by Player

parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: playerid
parameters.description: Unique FantasyData Player ID. Example:30000007.

get.description: Player Season Stats - by Player

parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: season
parameters.description:
Year of the season.
Examples: 2016, 2017.

parameters.name: playerid
parameters.description: Unique FantasyData Player ID. Example:30000378.

get.description: Year of the current season. This value changes at the start of the new league year. For leagues that run over two years, this is the year the season starts, not ends.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

get.description: Player Game Stats - by Player [Live & Final]

parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: date
parameters.description:
The date of the game(s).
Examples: 2018-JAN-31, 2017-OCT-01.

parameters.name: playerid
parameters.description: Unique FantasyData Player ID. Example:30000378.

get.description: Includes regular season standings in division and conference, from which postseason seeding can be derived.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: season
parameters.description:
Year of the season.
Examples: 2016, 2017.

get.description: Aggregated season stats allowed by each team against a given position (e.g. C, LW.)

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: season
parameters.description:
Year of the season.
Examples: 2016, 2017.

get.description: Full team information: team name and city, conference and division, and colors. Also contains basic fantasy info such as IDs as well as full stadium data. This endpoint returns all teams regardless of current active status.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

get.description: The line combinations - groups of skaters that play together - ordered and given by season.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: season
parameters.description:
Year of the season.
Examples: 2016, 2017.

get.description: DFW slates, salaries and positional information for a given date.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: date
parameters.description:
The date of the game(s).
Examples: 2017-DEC-01, 2018-FEB-15.

get.description: Specify a season, a player, and number of games (either an integer or all) to see all of their box score logs. Refreshed after their most recent game is complete.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: season
parameters.description: Season to get games from. Example 2019POST, 2020

parameters.name: playerid
parameters.description: Unique FantasyData Player ID. Example:30000651.

parameters.name: numberofgames
parameters.description: How many games to return. Example all, 10, 25

get.description: Game-by-game log of total team statistics for a given season, split up by game (not aggregated into season totals.)

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: season
parameters.description: Season to get games from. Example 2019POST, 2020

parameters.name: teamid
parameters.description: Unique ID of team. Example 8

parameters.name: numberofgames
parameters.description: How many games to return. Example all, 10, 25

get.description: Full statistical information for a specified game, down to the team and player stat level, delivered after the game is complete.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: gameid
parameters.description: The GameID of an NHL game. GameIDs can be found in the Games API. Valid entries are 14620 or 16905

get.description: Full statistical information for a specified date for each game that took place, down to the team and player stat level, delivered after the game is complete.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: date
parameters.description:
The date of the game(s).
Examples: 2017-OCT-31, 2018-FEB-15.

get.description: Returns the box score statistical record team-wide (aggregated from all players) for a given team's game in a given week after the game has concluded.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: date
parameters.description:
The date of the game(s).
Examples: 2018-JAN-31, 2017-OCT-01.

get.description: Returns the box score statistical record for all involved players across all teams' games on a given date after each game has concluded.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: date
parameters.description:
The date of the game(s).
Examples: 2017-OCT-31, 2018-FEB-15.

get.description: Simple fantasy points awarded to each player who took part in a game on a given date.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: date
parameters.description:
The date of the game(s).
Examples: 2017-OCT-31, 2018-FEB-15.
